your function computes the evaluation metrics and returns the sum of them. This one doesnâ€™t make much sense. Doing so mean the resulting evaluation (i.e. the final quantitative value) is dependent upon the length of the data given. What is important is how the pairwise data (e.g. within each row) performs, which is best statistically evaluated by a mean (e.g. via a returned list/ndarray), not a sum.
